page.title: 13SPECIAL EDUCATION-OPERATION
page.content: Each family unit producing a family atmosphere has a House Mother ,Junior House Mother and Junior Assistant in charge and there are always two people on duty at any time .Lessons include mobility training,braille,signing and also feeding, washing and dressing in addition to number work and reading. Not all children are totally blind. There are between 2 and 8 children in a class depending on their disability and the school staff number 112 including physiotherapists and nurses. Many of the pupils were born blind but others are blind as a result of accidents or their mother having German Measles (Rubella) during pregnacy.The school is fully residential with only a few returning home at weekends.When pupils leave Condover Hall they often enter outside industry or sheltered workshops.
